hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Transition on Failed High-Volume Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC is in NEUTRAL regime and attempts a high-volume breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper bound but fails to sustain above it for 2 consecutive 4-hour closes, a transition to BEAR regime occurs within the next 5 trading days with >70% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Failed breakouts in neutral markets often signal exhaustion of buying pressure and trap late bulls. High volume indicates significant capital commitment to the failed move, increasing reversal probability. Regulatory uncertainty (MiCA/UK framework) may amplify sensitivity to technical failures.
entry_conditions: BTC price breaks above 20-day BB upper band on volume > 1.5x 20-day average
Price fails to close above BB upper band for 2 consecutive 4-hour candles
RSI(14) on 4H chart > 65 at breakout attempt

exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC closes >2% above BB upper band on 4H timeframe

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of such signals result in continuation above BB or transition to BULL instead of BEAR regime.
